attributes.action: Allow Baby and Toddler Groups to Run in Level 4 in Scotland
attributes.additional_details: Antenatal depression is on the rise and to support mums and babies through the first months of a babies life should be classes as a priority and the Scottish government should allow us to run as they are aloud to still run in England under the current lockdown rules.
attributes.background: Allow the Scottish Government to see that baby and toddler groups are vital for baby development and maternal mental health and allow the groups to be run in a covid secure setting.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it. 

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
